channel.title: Server Help
channel.description:
Sorry if this is breaking a rule or in wrong section...
Ok I got a very very dumb question but I have my server down... I can logg in walk around and all that. I want to add more stuff in for example a quest.... in this link http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,441414.0.html I am told to open texthandler.java but its a file that I can't open. Another example is people say open client.java but were is this? I just need help on finding out how to open files so that I can add in my own things if you can help me please do so and sorry for being retarded

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @faze1one faze1one
item.description:
@faze1one wrote:

The file is called client, but if u look more to the rite it says JAVA file, thats client.java. Rite click it and open with notepad

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

In your Client.java you should have a sendQuest method, you can use that to create or go over old text on the client. sendQuest(“hello”, 1234); That is pretty much what it looks like in most servers, the 1234 is id of the text your changing.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @bily123 bily123
item.description:
@bily123 wrote:

[quote=“darkswerk, post:1, topic:357322”]Sorry if this is breaking a rule or in wrong section…

Ok I got a very very dumb question but I have my server down… I can logg in walk around and all that.
I want to add more stuff in for example a quest… in this link http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,441414.0.html
I am told to open texthandler.java but its a file that I can’t open.
Another example is people say open client.java but were is this?
I just need help on finding out how to open files so that I can add in my own things if you can help me please do so and sorry for being retarded[/quote]
These files are in the server’s folder. They should be able to open but if they somehow don’t do open with>notepad.

Read full topic
